title: Phrasal Verbs With Do And Make

exercises.title: Phrasal Verbs With Do and Make

questions.question: We cannot ..................... without food or water.
questions.description: To do without something is to manage without that.

questions.question: Child marriage is a bad custom and should be ………………. with.
questions.description: To do away with a custom is to abolish it.

questions.question: His elder brother did him ………………… his rightful inheritance.
questions.description: To do someone out of something is to prevent them from having it.

questions.question: We are ……………….. the kitchen on the weekend.
questions.description: To do up the kitchen is to renovate it.

questions.question: As soon as the thief saw the dog rushing towards him, he ……………… the gate.
questions.description: To make for the door is to move in the direction of the door.

questions.question: What do you make ……………….. her new boyfriend?
He made ……………….. as soon as he heard that his mother had fallen ill.
questions.description: To make off is to leave hurriedly.

questions.question: The superb food at the restaurant made ………………… the bad service.
questions.description: To make up for something is to compensate for it.

questions.question: The boy made ……………….. to his mother until she allowed him to go to the movies.
questions.description: To make up to somebody is to be nice to them with objective of getting something.

questions.question: The human body is ………………… of the five elements.
questions.description: Make up means compose or constitute.

questions.question: I find it rather difficult to make him ……………..
questions.description: To make somebody out is to understand them.

questions.question: I always fight with my husband but we …………………. soon after.
